segment.source: How to Manually Manage Applications in the Client Management Console
segment.target: How to Manually Manage Applications in the Client Management Console

segment.source: How to Manually Manage Applications in the Client Management Console
segment.target: How to Manually Manage Applications in the Client Management Console

segment.source: How to Manually Manage Applications in the Client Management Console
segment.target: How to Manually Manage Applications in the Client Management Console

segment.source: This section provides procedures for using the Application Virtualization Client Management Console to manually manage your virtual applications.
segment.target: This section provides procedures for using the Application Virtualization Client Management Console to manually manage your virtual applications.

segment.source: Provides a procedure you can use to add an application to the cache directly from the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.
segment.target: Provides a procedure you can use to add an application to the cache directly from the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.

segment.source: Provides a procedure you can use to publish application shortcuts to the desktop, menus, and tool bar directly from the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.
segment.target: Provides a procedure you can use to publish application shortcuts to the desktop, menus, and tool bar directly from the Application Virtualization Client Management Console.

segment.source: How to Add a File Type Association
segment.target: How to Add a File Type Association

segment.source: Provides a procedure you can use to add a file type association to an application.
segment.target: Provides a procedure you can use to add a file type association to an application.

segment.source: How to Delete a File Type Association
segment.target: How to Delete a File Type Association

segment.source: Provides a procedure you can use to delete a file type association.
segment.target: Provides a procedure you can use to delete a file type association.
